title: Credit Derivatives Determinations Committee asked about credit event on Russia's April bond
text:
"The bonds matured on April 4, 2022 but the payment of principal and interest due at maturity was not made until May 2," the question added. The notice through Euroclear was sent mid-May.

There are currently $2.54 billion of net notional credit default swaps (CDS) outstanding in relation to Russia, including $1.68 billion on the country itself and the remainder on the CDX.EM index, according to JPMorgan calculations.
